criteria: Understanding of Ratios and Proportional Relationships
Use of Mathematical Representations (Tables, Diagrams, Equations)
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of ratios, rates, or proportional relationships.
Student shows minimal understanding; struggles to identify ratios or set up proportions.
Student demonstrates some understanding of ratios and proportions but makes frequent errors in calculations and problem-solving.
Student can correctly set up and solve basic ratio and proportion problems but struggles with more complex scenarios.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of ratios and proportions, accurately solving most problems, including those with multiple steps.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of ratios and proportions, solving complex problems efficiently and accurately, and can explain their reasoning clearly.
Student is unable to apply ratio and rate reasoning to real-world problems.
Student struggles to connect ratio concepts to real-world scenarios; attempts are unsuccessful or irrelevant.
Student can identify some real-world applications but struggles to set up and solve the problems accurately.
Student can solve some real-world problems involving ratios and rates but may require guidance or make occasional errors.
Student can apply ratio and rate reasoning to solve a variety of real-world problems with accuracy and efficiency.
Student consistently and accurately applies ratio and rate reasoning to solve complex, real-world problems and can explain the implications of their solutions.
Student does not use tables, diagrams, or equations to represent or solve ratio problems.
Student attempts to use mathematical representations but does so incorrectly or ineffectively.
Student can create basic tables, diagrams, or equations but struggles to use them to solve problems accurately.
Student uses tables, diagrams, and equations to solve ratio problems but may make errors or require assistance.
Student effectively uses tables, diagrams, and equations to accurately solve a variety of ratio problems.
Student skillfully and creatively uses tables, diagrams, and equations to solve complex ratio problems and can explain the connections between different representations.
Student demonstrates no understanding of percent concepts.
Student struggles to calculate percentages or solve basic percent problems.
Student can calculate simple percentages but makes frequent errors in more complex problems.
Student can find a percent of a quantity and solve basic percent problems but struggles with finding the whole given a part and the percent.
Student can accurately solve a variety of percent problems, including finding the whole given a part and the percent.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of percent concepts, solving complex percent problems efficiently and accurately, and can explain the underlying principles.
